string-array.name: AncientEgyptianProfaneArray
string-array.item: Nkk-ţw `3 nk `3 ĥm.t=k \nMay you be raped by a donkey. May your wife be raped by a donkey \n(Curse of Rennfr - Deir el-Bahri)
Mt=k n ĥqr n iby\nMay you die of hunger or thirst \n(Curse of Herihor, High Priest of Amun)
Nn ĥpr rn=k m ta Kmt\nYour name shall not exist in the black land. \n(Curse of Herihor, High Priest of Amun)
S-uţet.ţw.k m Sthiw\nYou shall be cooked with the condemned \n(Tomb of Khety II, Dynasty 9-10)
Ušn-y ytet=k\nI shall wring your neck as a bird. \n(Curse of Hermeru, High Priest of Unis)
ţehuti nţr ush.f -ţw\nThe god Thoth shall destroy you.
Nn sħrenn-k mesmesiw=k. Nn m33=k nfr-t\nYou shall not embrace your children. You shall not see success
Šerr šwi-t=k\nYour years shall be diminished \n(Curse of Monthuemhat)
Nn ħpr `ĥyw=k ĥr t3\nYour lifetime shall not exist on earth \n(Curse of Senmut)
Nn ħpr-k\nYou shall not exist \n(Curse of Khnumhotep)
Nes yri-t=k n nes, nes pr=k n nesbit ywf-n\nYour estate shall belong to the fire, and your house shall belong to the consuming flame \n(Curse of Tefib)
Mest m`h3w-ţ=k ţw\nYour relatives shall detest you \n(Curse of Tefib)
ĥwr-k nemm-ţw-k\nYou shall be miserable and persecuted \n(Curse of Penniut, Dyn. 20)
ħnrtw i3w-t=k ĥnt ĥr=k rd(i)ţw-f m s nty ban=k\nYour office shall be taken away before your face and it shall be given to a man who is your enemy \n(scribe Amenhotep, Dyn. 18)
ħnrtw hm.t=k ĥnt ĥr=k\nYour wife shall be taken away before your face \n(Apanage Stele)
qes r ĥr=k\nYour face shall be spat at \n(El-Hassia tomb)
Nn m`ḏ3 r ib=k m ţn `ĥwa\nYour heart shall not be content in this life \n(Wersu)
ĥs3t `ĥ`m-tn y ĥm-nţr \nThe preist of Hathor will beat you twice! \n(Curse of Petety)
Seštw, teb, du un-ţn\nThe crocodile, hippopotamus and lion will eat you! \n(Curse of Petety)
ħpr=k ush ħpr-pr=k uš\nYou will be nowhere and your house will be nowhere! \n(Dynasty 5 curse)
Nn ħpr i3w-t=k nn ħpr i3w-t ms=k\nYour office shall not exist, the position of your son shall not exist \n(Curse of Sarenput, Nomarch of Senwosret)
Nn šesp-nţr =k t=k wbeħ \nYour god shall not accept your white bread \n(Curse of Sarenput, Nomarch of Senwosret)
Nes if=k n nes, nes mesmesiw=k n nesbit\nYour flesh shall belong to the fire, your children shall belong to the fire. \n(Curse of Sarenput, Nomarch of Senwosret)
Nn ħpr ħa=k n s3-t\nYour corpse will not be in the ground \n(Curse of Sarenput, Nomarch of Senwosret)
Beš-k iw šdd-k pn\nMay you be sick when you read this. \n(El Lahun Missive)

string-array.name: BongoProfaneArray
string-array.item: Cunt.\nVulgar slang. Female genitalia. An objectionable person.
Mother Fucker.\nTerm of rebuke for an irritating or ridiculous person.
Fuck.\nTo have sex with. To express annoyance, contempt, or impatience
Wanker.\nSomeone who masturbates. A contemptible person.
Bastard.\nA person born of parents not married to each other. An unpleasant or dispicable person.
Prick.\nMale genetalia, penis. Term of censure for an individual.
Bollocks.\nMale genitalia, testicles. Expression of doubt.
Arsehole.\nAnus. Derisive term for a stupid or irritating person.
Twat.\nFemale genitalia. An objectionable person. Moderately offensive.
Piss Off.\nInstruction to leave alone, or go away, immediately.
Spastic.\nVernacular term for a disabled person.
Shit.\nExcrement. Adjective for something of poor quality, rubbish.
Knob Head.\nTerm of rebuke for an objectionable person. "Knob" is a slang term for penis.
Bugger.\nThe act of sodomy, or an individual who practices sodomy.
Jesus Fucking Christ.\nSon of God in the Christian doctrine. Exclamation of surpise
Holy Crap.\nReligious offensive term. Exclamation, interjection.
Jesus, Joseph, Mary, And The Little Fucking Donkey.\nWhimsically offensive religious exclamation.

string-array.name: ShakespeareProfaneArray
string-array.item: Thou subtle, perjur`d, false, disloyal man.\nThe Two Gentlemen of Verona
Thou art like a toad; ugly and venemous.\nAs You Like It
Thine backward voice is to utter foul speeches and to detract\nThe Tempest
Thou art a flesh-monger, a fool and a coward.\nMeasure for Measure
A most notable coward, an infinite and endless liar\nAlls Well That Ends Well
An hourly promise breaker, the owner of no one good quality\nAlls Well That Ends Well
Thy tongue outvenoms all the worms of Nile.\nCymbeline
You scullion! You rampallian! You fustilarian! I`ll tickle your catastrophe.\nHenry IV Part 2
Methink`st thou art a general offence and every man should beat thee.\nAlls Well That Ends Well
Thou art as loathsome as a toad\nTroilus and Cressida
Thou whoreson obscene greasy tallow-catch.\nHenry IV Part 1
You starvelling, you eel-skin, you dried neat`s-tongue\nHenry IV Part 1
You bull`s-pizzle, you stock-fish–O for breath to utter what is like thee.-\nHenry IV Part 1
You tailor`s-yard, you sheath, you bow-case, you vile standing tuck.\nHenry IV Part 1
Peace, ye fat guts.\nHenry IV Part 1
Thou poisonous bunch-back`d toad.\nHenry IV Part 1
Thou art unfit for any place but hell\nRichard III
Your virginity breeds mites, much like a cheese.\nRichard III
Thou are pigeon-liver`d and lack gall.\nAlls Well That Ends Well
You are as a candle, the better burnt out.\nHamlet
Thy sin`s not accidental, but a trade.\nHenry IV Part 1
Clod of wayward marl\nMeasure for Measure
Thou elvish-mark`d, abortive, rooting hog\nMuch Ado About Nothing
Dread prince of plackets, king of codpieces\nRichard III
That trunk of humours, That bolting-hutch of beastliness\nLove`s labour`s Lost
That swollen parcel of dropsies,that huge bombard of sack \nHenry IV Part 1
That stuffed cloak-bag of guts, that roasted Manningtree ox with the pudding in his belly\nHenry IV Part 1
That reverance vice, that grey iniquity, that father ruffian, that vanity of years.\nHenry IV Part 1
Is not your voice broken, your wind short, your chin double, your wit single, and every part about you blasted with antiquity?\nHenry IV Part 1
When the age is in, the wit is out.\nHenry IV Part 1
Veriest varlet that ever chewed with a tooth\nMuch Ado About Nothing
Why, thou picture of what thou scemest, and idol of idiot-worshippers, here`s a letter for thee\nThe Tempest
The devil damn thee black, thou cream-faced loon\nTroilus and Cressida
Thou art a boil, A plague-sore, an embossed carbuncle\nMacbeth
Blush, blush, thou lump of foul deformity\nKing Lear
Thou crusty botch of nature\nRichard III
Ah, you whoreson loggerhead, you were born to do me shame\nTroilus and Cressida
Away, Thou art poison to my blood\nLove`s labour`s Lost
An inhuman wretch, uncapable of pity, void and empty from any dram of mercy \nCymbeline
A slave whose gall coins slanders like a mint\nThe Merchant of Venice
A monster, a very monster in apparel\nTroilus and Cressida
A foul and pestilent congregation of vapours. \nThe Taming of the Shrew
What a piece of work is man.\nThe Taming of the Shrew
Base dunghill villain and mechanical, I`ll have thy head\nHamlet
Boils and plagues plaster you over\nHenry VI Part 2
That you may be abhorred farther than seen and one infect another against the wind a mile. \nHenry VI Part 2
You souls of geese that bear the shapes of men\nHenry VI Part 2
Curtailed of this fair proportion, cheated of feature by dissembling nature, deformed, unfinished\nHenry VI Part 2
Deep, hollow, treacherous and full of guile\nOthello
Despised substance of divinest show\nRichard III
Dissembling harlot, thou are false in all \nRomeo and Juliet
False of heart, light of ear\nComedy of Errors
Bloody of hand, hog in sloth\nComedy of Errors
Fox in stealth, wolf in greediness\nComedy of Errors
Dog in madness, lion in prey\nComedy of Errors
Foul spoken coward, that thund`rest with thy tongue\nKing Lear
From the extremest upward of thy head to the descent and dust beneath thy foot, a most toad spotted traitor\nTitus Andronicus
Hang yourself, you muddy conger \nKing Lear
Hang, beg, starve, die in the streets\nHenry IV Part 2
How foul and loathsome is thine image \nRomeo And Juliet
His kisses are Judas`s own children\nThe Taming of the Shrew
[Thy] kiss is comfortless as frozen water to a starved snake\nAnthony and Cleopatra
Thy bones are hollow; impiety has mad a feast of thee.\nTroilus and Cressida
[Thou] vicious mole of nature.\nMeasure for Measure
Drop into the rotten mouth of death\nHamlet
I shall shake thy bones out of thy garments.\nRichard III
Thou wilt fall backward when thou hast more wit.\nHenry IV Part 2
[Your] brain is as dry as the remainder biscuit after a voyage.\nRomeo and Juliet
Thou wilt be as valiant as the wrathful dove, or most magnanimous mouse\nTroilus and Cressida
A fool go with thy soul, whither it goes.\nHenry IV
You are a shallow cowardly hind, and you lie.\nHenry IV

resources.string:
This application will curse in your language of your choice whenever your phone is shaken. The harder you shake your phone the more offensive the profanity. 

The profanities used in the original “Bongo English” list stem from research into the use of profanities in English undertaken jointly by the Advertising Standards Authority,and British Broadcasting Corporation, “Delete Expletives?” [2000].

 The use and history of expletives, profanities and curses is likely to be as ancient as the origins of language itself. This application aims to simultaneously entertain, amuse and educate. Indeed the icon used to launch the app is a "grawlix" (Lexicon of Comicana - Mort Walker [1980])- of the type seen in comics used as a substitute for profanities 

The etymology of each expletive is explained, although in some instances this may be conjectural.

The author of this application has made the conscious decision to remove racial and most religious profanity.

I hope that this application offends everyone that uses it. However, that statement is meant with the best of intentions! Now f**k off and enjoy the app!
Are you sure you want to exit?
Select the language pack to use
Change the interval time between events
Start as a service on device boot
